trans-unit.source: How to Create a Custom Virtual Machine
trans-unit.target: How to Create a Custom Virtual Machine

trans-unit.source: A *custom* virtual machine refers to a virtual machine you create using the **From Gallery** method because it lets you configure more options than the **Quick Create** method.
trans-unit.target: A *custom* virtual machine refers to a virtual machine you create using the **From Gallery** method because it lets you configure more options than the **Quick Create** method.

trans-unit.source: These options include:
trans-unit.target: These options include:

trans-unit.source: More choices for the image to use to create the virtual machine (VM)
trans-unit.target: More choices for the image to use to create the virtual machine (VM)

trans-unit.source: Connecting the VM to a virtual network
trans-unit.target: Connecting the VM to a virtual network

trans-unit.source: Adding the VM to an existing cloud service
trans-unit.target: Adding the VM to an existing cloud service

trans-unit.source: Adding the VM to an availability set
trans-unit.target: Adding the VM to an availability set

trans-unit.source: **Important**: If you want your virtual machine to use a virtual network so you can connect to it directly by hostname or set up cross-premises connections, make sure you specify the virtual network when you create the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: **Important**: If you want your virtual machine to use a virtual network so you can connect to it directly by hostname or set up cross-premises connections, make sure you specify the virtual network when you create the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: A virtual machine can be configured to join a virtual network only when you create the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: A virtual machine can be configured to join a virtual network only when you create the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For more information about virtual networks, see [Azure Virtual Network Overview](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=294063).
trans-unit.target: For more information about virtual networks, see [Azure Virtual Network Overview](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=294063).

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com).

trans-unit.source: On the command bar, click **New**.
trans-unit.target: On the command bar, click **New**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Compute**, click **Virtual Machine**, and then click **From Gallery**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Compute**, click **Virtual Machine**, and then click **From Gallery**.

trans-unit.source: Choose the image you want to use, and then click the arrow to continue.
trans-unit.target: Choose the image you want to use, and then click the arrow to continue.

trans-unit.source: If multiple versions of the image are available, in **Version Release Date**, pick the version you want to use.
trans-unit.target: If multiple versions of the image are available, in **Version Release Date**, pick the version you want to use.

trans-unit.source: In **Virtual Machine Name**, type the name that you want to use for the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: In **Virtual Machine Name**, type the name that you want to use for the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Use **Tier** and **Size** to select the appropriate size for the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Use **Tier** and **Size** to select the appropriate size for the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The size you select affects the maximum configuration of the virtual machine, as well as the pricing.
trans-unit.target: The size you select affects the maximum configuration of the virtual machine, as well as the pricing.

trans-unit.source: For configuration details, see [Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=389844).
trans-unit.target: For configuration details, see [Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=389844).

trans-unit.source: In **New User Name**, type a name for the administrative account that you want to use to manage the server.
trans-unit.target: In **New User Name**, type a name for the administrative account that you want to use to manage the server.

trans-unit.source: In **New Password**, type a strong password for the administrative account.
trans-unit.target: In **New Password**, type a strong password for the administrative account.

trans-unit.source: In **Confirm Password**, retype the same password.
trans-unit.target: In **Confirm Password**, retype the same password.

trans-unit.source: Click the arrow to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click the arrow to continue.

trans-unit.source: In **Cloud Service**, do one of the following:
trans-unit.target: In **Cloud Service**, do one of the following:

trans-unit.source: If this is the first or only virtual machine in the cloud service, select **Create a New Cloud Service**.
trans-unit.target: If this is the first or only virtual machine in the cloud service, select **Create a New Cloud Service**.

trans-unit.source: Then, in **Cloud Service DNS Name**, type a name that uses between 3 and 24 lowercase letters and numbers.
trans-unit.target: Then, in **Cloud Service DNS Name**, type a name that uses between 3 and 24 lowercase letters and numbers.

trans-unit.source: This name becomes part of the URI that is used to contact the virtual machine through the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: This name becomes part of the URI that is used to contact the virtual machine through the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: If this virtual machine is being added to a cloud service, select it in the list.
trans-unit.target: If this virtual machine is being added to a cloud service, select it in the list.

trans-unit.source: **Note**: For more information about placing virtual machines in the same cloud service, see [How to connect virtual machines in a cloud service](http://www.windowsazure.com/manage/windows/how-to-guides/connect-to-a-cloud-service/).
trans-unit.target: **Note**: For more information about placing virtual machines in the same cloud service, see [How to connect virtual machines in a cloud service](http://www.windowsazure.com/manage/windows/how-to-guides/connect-to-a-cloud-service/).

trans-unit.source: In **Region/Affinity Group/Virtual Network**, select region, affinity group, or virtual network that you want to use for the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: In **Region/Affinity Group/Virtual Network**, select region, affinity group, or virtual network that you want to use for the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For more information about affinity groups, see [About Affinity Groups for Virtual Network](../virtual-network/virtual-networks-migrate-to-regional-vnet.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about affinity groups, see [About Affinity Groups for Virtual Network](../virtual-network/virtual-networks-migrate-to-regional-vnet.md).

trans-unit.source: In **Storage Account**, select an existing storage account for the VHD file, or use an automatically generated storage account.
trans-unit.target: In **Storage Account**, select an existing storage account for the VHD file, or use an automatically generated storage account.

trans-unit.source: Only one storage account per region is automatically created.
trans-unit.target: Only one storage account per region is automatically created.

trans-unit.source: All other virtual machines that you create with this setting are located in this storage account.
trans-unit.target: All other virtual machines that you create with this setting are located in this storage account.

trans-unit.source: You are limited to 20 storage accounts.
trans-unit.target: You are limited to 20 storage accounts.

trans-unit.source: If you want the virtual machine to belong to an availability set, in **Availability Set**, select **Create availability set** or add it to an existing availability set.
trans-unit.target: If you want the virtual machine to belong to an availability set, in **Availability Set**, select **Create availability set** or add it to an existing availability set.

trans-unit.source: **Note**: Virtual machine that are members of an availability set are deployed to different fault domains.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: Virtual machine that are members of an availability set are deployed to different fault domains.

trans-unit.source: Placing multiple virtual machines in an availability set helps ensure that your application is available during network failures, local disk hardware failures, and any planned downtime.
trans-unit.target: Placing multiple virtual machines in an availability set helps ensure that your application is available during network failures, local disk hardware failures, and any planned downtime.

trans-unit.source: Under **Endpoints**, review the new endpoints that will be created to allow connections to the virtual machine, such through Remote Desktop or a Secure Shell (SSH) client.
trans-unit.target: Under **Endpoints**, review the new endpoints that will be created to allow connections to the virtual machine, such through Remote Desktop or a Secure Shell (SSH) client.

trans-unit.source: You also can add endpoints now, or create them later.
trans-unit.target: You also can add endpoints now, or create them later.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on creating them later, see [How to Set Up Endpoints to a Virtual Machine](../articles/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-set-up-endpoints.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on creating them later, see [How to Set Up Endpoints to a Virtual Machine](../articles/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-set-up-endpoints.md).

trans-unit.source: Under **VM Agent**, decide whether to install the VM Agent.
trans-unit.target: Under **VM Agent**, decide whether to install the VM Agent.

trans-unit.source: This agent provides the environment for you to install extensions that can help you interact with the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: This agent provides the environment for you to install extensions that can help you interact with the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Manage Extensions](http://go.microsoft.com/FWLink/p/?LinkID=390493).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Manage Extensions](http://go.microsoft.com/FWLink/p/?LinkID=390493).

trans-unit.source: Click the arrow to create the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Click the arrow to create the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: After the virtual machine is created, it's started automatically.
trans-unit.target: After the virtual machine is created, it's started automatically.

trans-unit.source: When the portal shows the status as running, you can log in to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: When the portal shows the status as running, you can log in to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see one of the following articles:
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see one of the following articles:

trans-unit.source: How to Log on to a Virtual Machine Running Linux
trans-unit.target: How to Log on to a Virtual Machine Running Linux

trans-unit.source: How to Log on to a Virtual Machine Running Windows Server
trans-unit.target: How to Log on to a Virtual Machine Running Windows Server
